programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

With the threat of child protective services looming, the clock is ticking to find answers and rebuild shattered lives.

programme.title: Dr. Ira Reid: Haverford College's Unsung Scholar Activist
programme.desc: Dr. Ira De Augustine Reid, was a prominent sociologist and proficient writer who wrote on the lives of black immigrants and communities throughout the United States. Follow along his story of perseverance and relentless pursuit and how he became the first tenured African-American Faculty member of Haverford College and left a historical impact on the world of academia.

programme.title: Dream on Dreamer

programme.title: Hoodie Girls Gang

programme.title: The Far Horizons
programme.desc: Following the Louisiana Purchase, President Thomas Jefferson assigns Capt. Meriwether Lewis (Fred MacMurray) and Lt. William Clark (Charlton Heston) to an expedition to explore the new U.S. territory. Guided by the Native American woman Sacajawea (Donna Reed), Lewis and Clark embark on a journey through unknown and treacherous terrain in hopes of finding a water route from St. Louis to the Pacific Ocean. While attempting to rid the plains of raiders, Sioux Chief Yellow Eagle (Ian MacDonald) and his warriors discover the scene of the massacre. They adopt the sole survivor, a young boy, and rename him Warbonnet. When Derringer learns that 13 passengers and crew died at sea during it's voyage to New Orleans, he takes a closer look at its passengers, particularly a cute Irish lass, a cousin of Madame Francine, who booked passage to America to find a husband.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer

Yancy expected a Boston battle-ax, but he's smitten with her charm and wit. Colton has a heavy workload, fending off crime czar Lance Carter, and wowing Agatha with his Reconstruction wizardry, while building a romantic blockade between her and Yancy.

programme.desc: While escorting to prison the leader of a notorious gang, a sheriff and a deputy are attacked by the gang.

programme.desc: It's the Civil War, and Union spy James J. Andrews (Fess Parker) is on a top-secret mission: to steal a Confederate train outside of Atlanta and take it back to Union territory in Tennessee, using it to sabotage and destroy Confederate supply routes along the way. But the train's conductor (Jeffrey Hunter) is on to Andrews and is determined to try his best to throw a wrench in the Union spy's plans before he delivers the train to his fellow soldiers.

programme.desc: Slade hunts a bank robber who has murdered two people.

programme.desc: Jim Kipp (Randolph Scott) is a bounty hunter hired to find three robbers who committed a daring heist three years ago. However, many of the townspeople -- including Dr. Spencer (Harry Antrim), his daughter, Julie (Dolores Dorn), and barmaid Alice (Marie Windsor) -- are put on edge by Kipp's presence and want him gone. Kipp perseveres, hatching a plan that he thinks will draw out the bandits.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: 10 celebrities will be taking the reindeer-drawn celebrity sleigh to the top of the Qualifier.

programme.desc: Winter Wipeout once again challenges some of the nation's most famous faces to tackle obstacle course.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season. This time, all of them face 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring Worlds Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bons Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australias very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This episode welcomes a set of contestants to take on some hard obstacles for the cash prize and the trophy.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 fabulous contestants travel halfway across the globe to the purpose-built course in Buenos Aires.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their endurance and bouncability in Argentina.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' with all of the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 7 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season. This time, all of them face 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam Gods Gift Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isnt enough for you then youll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. Its all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. Nat with the Tats and Renee Lets get physical move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. Its a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol is looking at one of the gems of early spring; the crocus, Joe visits a bog garden in west Wales, and Rachel visits a fabulous rose garden with over 2500 different varieties.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol looks at the spring delight that is the cyclamen, Joe visits a gardener taking on the challenges of gardening on the windswept Cornish coastline, and Monty tackles the problem of box blight.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives his pond a spring clean, Carol helps a family in Gloucestershire with their first garden, and Joe visits a gardener in Northumberland who copes with extremes of temperature.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein admires the true harbinger of spring, the daffodil. Also, a visit to dahlia enthusiast Darren Everest on his allotment in Kent, and Monty Don pots up his dahlia tubers, and offers tips for getting the best results later in the year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is giving his ornamental grasses an overhaul. He's got tips on how to lift and divide ones that have grown too large. Meanwhile, Rachel visits the stunning Trebah Garden in Cornwall to revel in their glorious collection of hydrangeas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don finishes rejuvenating his dry garden, a sun baked corner of the garden that had become over-run by thuggish plants, and Carol Klein is in the rather exotic setting of Abbotsbury Subtropical Gardens in Dorset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has suggestions for beautiful climbers that thrive in shady spots and gets on with planting up his vegetable garden, while Carol Klein returns to help first time gardeners, Dan and Dominique.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with eminent plantsman Keith Wiley, at his garden in Devon, celebrating the exquisite dog's tooth violet. At Longmeadow, Monty Don cracks on with some timely tasks and makes a start on planting up a yew hedge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the renowned RHS Malvern Spring Festival, otherwise known affectionately as the `plants and people show', Monty Don gets an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at the impressive displays, plants and show gardens on offer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don turns his attention to planting out his sweet peas and potting up lilies, and Carol Klein returns to Gloucestershire to help first-time gardeners, Dan and Dominique, plant up their new border in the style of a cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don offers advice on making the perfect herb garden - and plants out some beautiful garden stalwarts into his cottage borders, while Carol Klein is with new gardeners Dan and Dominique, giving their veg patch a necessary kick-start.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Mark Kayser in in Montana as the whitetail rut is dying down, thankfully for him, his tag is good for whitetail or mule deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Phillip Culpepper is back, and he and the crew chase wild turkeys in the Sunshine State. Obviously, Spring Thunder is rolling in full force, and this week, we join the crew down south in Florida. Conditions are rough, but the guys stay after it and close the distance.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that weve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time weve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to the Lowcountry to rendezvous with good friend Capt. Ben Alderman.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike reunites with his South Seas comrade for a day of trout madness.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisianas rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins great friends Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, Chris Hamaway, and local Capt. Gonzalo Castillo for an epic day of Mahi fishing just offshore in Los Cabos, Mexico.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins Capt. Eric Reynolds & Jessica Ocasio on a sporty adventure offshore from Islamorada in search of Swordfish.

programme.desc: The Crew hunts the Indiana farm to chase one of the mature bucks that call the farm home.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: We head back to North Dakota for our annual hunting trip and have a few really good days!

programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we arent talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Part of our North Dakota crew joins us in Illinois to shoot green heads in The Land of Lincoln.

programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to North Dakota for his annual whitetail/mule deer hunt with good friend, Todd Fuller.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson and Zach chase big honkers and mallards in a dry field in their back yard in Indiana.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson Wentz, Ryan Kelly, and DeForest Buckner shoot limits of doves in Indiana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel of All Things Hunting Scout, Prepare and Execute a late season duck hunt in a Cypress Break in the State of Louisiana. A successful duck hunt takes three things to accomplish, Great Gear, Hard Work, Finding where the ducks want to be, and this hunt has them all.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. After that Kyle teams up with good friend Chris Griffin where they head to another Ranch on the border and hunt two giant Aoudad rams with a rifles.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouris gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the Show Me state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, its no different. With Winchesters in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in Americathe wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally well take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team heads over to FGCI FiberGlass Coatings to learn about their innovative product, Paintable FiberGlass. This will be used to help touch up some scratches in the Taco Marine Project boat. We also receive very helpful maintenance tips to keep you running smoothly when out on the water.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, we are cruising the islands of the Caribbean on board a luxury super yacht. From Antigua to Martinique, St Lucia to the Grenadines, its a picture perfect paradise.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor utilize the Yellowfin Hybrid 26 to bring the Live Paddle Boards out to an Islamorada flat for a fun day of fishing for bonefish and some toothy critters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: David Gilane chronicles the last couple of years of him going down to Texas and chasing exotic axis deer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesnt come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didnt think it was.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve go yellow tailing out of Hawks Cay for a limit of tasty yellowtail snapper and Steve picks a battle with a big lemon shark.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve bounce around the reefs out of Hawks Cay catching a wide variety of reef dwellers.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take their brand new Invincible 36 out of Plantation Boat Mart to fly the kites for some early season sailfishing

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve make a big run from Plantation Boat Mart in the Invincible 36into the green Gulf waters to fill the Yeti cooler and battle with some seas monsters.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: A day of reef fishing in Islamorada turns into a Kingfish and Yellowtail frenzy for Captains Scott and Steve.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: It only takes 3 fish to fill the Yeti cooler when Capt Scott fishes the top with kites for Wahoo and Steve pulls a big Mutton Snapper off the bottom.

programme.title: reel_animals
programme.desc: Embark on an unforgettable fishing expedition with Captain Dallas King in the breathtaking Nature Coast. Get ready for heart-pounding action as Mike and dallas target Redfish and Trout from Crystal River.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Cody Chivas takes Capt. Mike offshore for a mixedcatch of SWFL fish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesnt hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Day 2 of competition for the 2024 Thousand Islands Open out of downtown Kingston, Ontario. The field will be cut in half at the days end.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The second event day in Cornwall, Ontario takes place on Lake St. Francis where big rains have things stirred up for the teams.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP teaches you how to disect a jungle when targeting Largemouth Bass with a Slop Frog.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads to a new body of water in search of Largemouth and Smallmouth Bass right after a major front blew through the area.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboythats the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberrys own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In our final episode in Japan, the DIRT team went road-tripping through beautiful, snowy Japanese landscapesand tasting everything in sight. A crown jewel in the northeast corner of Japan, Hokkaido may be famous among skiers and snowboarders for the luscious "Japow," but way beyond the tourist trail there's a burgeoning new food scene and a unique and vibrant history. Though, if we're honest, Josh probably could've spent the whole trip carving up the mountain and been a happy camper.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Joshs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farmits all on the menu.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Panama is known for its world-class and virtually untouched fisheries. Isla Boca Brava is no exception. We assembled a dream team of anglers from all over the U.S. to test their specialized fishing techniques on the trip of a lifetime. Follow Mike Roy, Benny Ortiz, and Brandon Nelson as they head down to Tucan Lodge and meet up with Juan Spragge of Tucan Lodge Panama for a few days on the water they wont soon forget.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob participates in the 2023 Keymorada Tournament in Islamorada. This tournament, held out of the Cheeca Lodge, benefits "The Crohns & Colitis Foundation".

programme.title: Silver Kings

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob has the always hilarious Clay Guest aka "Flounder" to see if the Texas boy can "bring it"!

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob is joined by beloved keys guide Capt. Johnny Sheehan for a day of tarpon fishing in the backcountry on Johnny's 60th birthday.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: The Blue Bonefish Lodge in San Pedro Belize serves as headquarters for Capt. Jared Raskob and special guest BTT's Dr. Aaron Adams on a quest for a Belize Slam and to learn about bonefish interconnectivity.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: The teams shares best practices for identifying and hunting whitetail bedding areas.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Each year the United States celebrates those who sacrificed protecting and serving this country, so that we can enjoy our freedoms and live our lives as we choose. Host Mark Stowe and friends Wes Thomas and Terry McWilliams take a couple of those veterans for a day on the water that no one will soon forget. Presented by Indiana 811.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Sheila Mitchell-Murphy honors the memory her SonAmerican hero Etienne Murphy.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Mark Kayser in in Montana as the whitetail rut is dying down, thankfully for him, his tag is good for whitetail or mule deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Phillip Culpepper is back, and he and the crew chase wild turkeys in the Sunshine State. Obviously, Spring Thunder is rolling in full force, and this week, we join the crew down south in Florida. Conditions are rough, but the guys stay after it and close the distance.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that weve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time weve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to the Lowcountry to rendezvous with good friend Capt. Ben Alderman.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike reunites with his South Seas comrade for a day of trout madness.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisianas rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins great friends Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, Chris Hamaway, and local Capt. Gonzalo Castillo for an epic day of Mahi fishing just offshore in Los Cabos, Mexico.

programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins Capt. Eric Reynolds & Jessica Ocasio on a sporty adventure offshore from Islamorada in search of Swordfish.

programme.desc: *Part 1* Zach and Carson Wentz hunt the early season in Kentucky hoping to catch up with velvet bucks.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Cameraman, Kyle gets behind the bow for a couple hunts in Kentucky and connects with his first buck in over 5 years.

programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head home to North Dakota to chase geese, ducks, and pheasants.

programme.desc: The Crew hunts the Indiana farm to chase one of the mature bucks that call the farm home.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: We head back to North Dakota for our annual hunting trip and have a few really good days!

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we arent talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Josephs Bay on Blacks Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Part of our North Dakota crew joins us in Illinois to shoot green heads in The Land of Lincoln.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head to Texas for their annual hunt with the Natures Eye crew.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to North Dakota for his annual whitetail/mule deer hunt with good friend, Todd Fuller.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson and Zach chase big honkers and mallards in a dry field in their back yard in Indiana.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach is back to the homeland for Part 3 of chasing ducks.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson Wentz, Ryan Kelly, and DeForest Buckner shoot limits of doves in Indiana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel of All Things Hunting Scout, Prepare and Execute a late season duck hunt in a Cypress Break in the State of Louisiana. A successful duck hunt takes three things to accomplish, Great Gear, Hard Work, Finding where the ducks want to be, and this hunt has them all.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. After that Kyle teams up with good friend Chris Griffin where they head to another Ranch on the border and hunt two giant Aoudad rams with a rifles.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouris gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the Show Me state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, its no different. With Winchesters in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in Americathe wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboythats the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberrys own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In our final episode in Japan, the DIRT team went road-tripping through beautiful, snowy Japanese landscapesand tasting everything in sight. A crown jewel in the northeast corner of Japan, Hokkaido may be famous among skiers and snowboarders for the luscious "Japow," but way beyond the tourist trail there's a burgeoning new food scene and a unique and vibrant history. Though, if we're honest, Josh probably could've spent the whole trip carving up the mountain and been a happy camper.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Joshs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farmits all on the menu.
