Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: Blasting on the scene in October of 1966 in Oakland, California, the Black Panther Party were a subversive civil rights group who became international sensations with a freedom by any means necessary philosophy. Along the way they empowered a generation but they also raised a lot of hell, tangled with police forces across the nation and were eventually public enemy number of the FBIs infamous COINTELPRO program, which essentially targeted and wiped out numerous African American organizations. CCF looks at the life and crimes of its founders Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale and its shining princess, the great Angela Davis.

programme.title: Payback

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: We explore how entrepreneurs reduce waste, enhance recycling and transform reused materials into unique goods. These efforts craft a sustainable tomorrow.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From a dance instructor who prioritizes mental health for her students, to a high school baseball coach who exemplified courage, KC athletes show off their formulas for success.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three brutal cold cases remain unsolved for decades until advances in forensic technology bring investigators closer than ever to finding answers for the victims families and friends.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Heart, soul and sauce overfloweth when Chef Linda Green (a.k.a. The Yakamein Lady) goes up against Chef Estrada from the House of Blues. When youve got two chefs who pack a plate with this much love, there are no losers.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Ryan, Justin, and Jimmy enjoy a Cincinnati summer playing pickleball for charity. Ryan and Jimmy compete in an ice cream taste test. Later, Justin takes a young lady on a shopping spree to celebrate her resilience in addressing her mental health.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Kar is a selfless soul known for his unwavering commitment to the unhoused in his community. It's Kar's turn to have some good old-fashioned fun.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin, Ryan and Tony introduce us to a real-life superhero who has opened her home and heart to special needs children.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Go on a kayak adventure, grab some unique eats, and zipline your heart out on a trip to this happening city on the Monongahela river.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Eating vegan is good for animals, the environment, and your health. Can it also be good for your taste buds? In this episode, we take a behind the scenes look at some of Pittsburghs most popular vegan restaurants.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Every day, regular people put in hard work to make their dreams come true whether it's a dream job, a dream adventure, or a dream to help others.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Splish splash, will the would-be criminals take a bath? These wild stories wind up in bodies of water that you have to see to believe.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: Erica Powell will not be slowed down. After cancer treatments as an infant left her legally blind, she is fueled to become a world-class athlete and a beacon of inspiration to others.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day venture to Verona and explore the spot thats more than a dot. The guys play pickleball, dine on BBQ, get creative with splatter paint, and finish the day with a brew.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: A car or the T might be the typical way to travel, but Robs on a mission to explore some of the more unique modes of transport the Boston areas got to offer.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: From sky high treetop adventures to bewitching rituals, Maddy and Dixie conquer their fears and get out of their comfort zones.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A Boston jeweler with a unique medium, and kitty spaceships in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Costumes are a part of the fabric that makes up New Orleans. As three local designers will find out nothing is easy in the Big Easy as they compete in creating one-of-a-kind costumes inspired by the Crescent City and the river that shapes it.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they wont give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Every day, people go above and beyond for their communities. After clocking out, they continue to lend a hand, like a former firefighter giving away his earnings and a veteran making sure others have a place to sleep.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact focuses on issues facing youth. We travel to a rural California high school where teachers are coming together to address teen mental health. Plus, the Luddite Club founders explain why they gave up smartphones and social media. And, the high cost of college is prompting young adults to consider other options.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the citys unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From meditating in a salt cave to braving a cold plunge, Rob treats his mind, body and soul to a variety of holistic therapies.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Whether it's a wrestling star training through grief, champion rollerskaters challenged on the world stage, or a cycling team pushing through obstacles, Iowans don't back down when the going gets tough.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Don't miss this drag-tastic adventure as Amanda and ABQ legend, Marcus Montoya, AKA Vanessa Patricks, put their best feet forward. Together, they'll learn some killer moves and toast to an iconic evening on Albuquerque's most inclusive stage.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Experience the different ways individuals and communities across the country preserve the memories of their families, friends and cities. From impressive craftsmanship to generous deeds, they ensure that things may be gone but never forgotten.

programme.title: Pulse: Orlando Still Strong
programme.desc: Two journalists describe the lasting impact of the Pulse nightclub shooting.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find school lunch from a celebrity chef, the go-to spot for iconic local T-shirts, and a thriving female-run small business oasis? The same place where Coca-Cola was first bottled and an ancient artifact was eerily exposed.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin sends Ryan on a thrilling musical journey in Nashville with just $20 and drumsticks to earn his ticket back home. On the scorching sidewalks of Music City, Ryan is humbled and uplifted by the generosity of those who have the least to give.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Single father Kendal Fenwick is the 295th homicide in Baltimore in 2015. Family and investigators wonder whether his efforts to curb drugs and violence in his neighborhood made him a target. Or is it something else entirely?

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day get competitive over a round of golf and learn a new twist on old fashion cocktail making before heading to Apis Meadery in Carnegie.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Anna is a radio personality living her best life in Cincinnati. Since her dating life has gone static, shes giving three blind dates a try. Three local bachelors will try to impress her with an archery date, making candles and playing golf.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Join us on an international culinary tour of Greenville as we dine on Birria tacos at Califas, Falafels at Pita House, curries and dosas at Swad Indian Restaurant and torched salmon rolls at Purple International Bistro & Sushi

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Local Kansas City notables Chef Shanita, Don Daughtry Sr., and the owners of Duet share where to go for cinnamon whiskey, an immersive historical experience, yoga with plants in paradise and more!

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: At only 21 years old, Isabelle Sander has overcome a lot in her young life with hearing loss. However, to prove to herself and others that a diagnosis doesn't define a person, she is on a mission to participate in nature and be active outdoors.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Patrick Shea, Chef and Owner of CK Pearl and Decklyns in Essex and Gloucester and Chef Kladji Plaku, Chef de Cuisine at City Table, City Barn & Solas in Boston engage in a battle of culinary skill. Will a surprise guest judge change everything?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Meet Pat and Patty, an engaged couple who fell on hard times while planning their dream wedding. The team comes together to throw these two a special day they'll never forget!

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes exploiting online generosity are a growing trend. These real-life stories show people going to great lengths to con unsuspecting donors out of their money.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Dedicated mom and nurse, Cleo, spends a day filled with surprises. This incredible mother has overcome obstacles no parent should have to face. Cleo and her sons cook up some quality time.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: We explore how entrepreneurs reduce waste, enhance recycling and transform reused materials into unique goods. These efforts craft a sustainable tomorrow.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nations largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, Americas native spirit.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Splish splash, will the would-be criminals take a bath? These wild stories wind up in bodies of water that you have to see to believe.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Ripper
programme.desc: A vicious killer is on the loose in Yorkshire, England. He preys on the most vulnerable people using household tools to commit murder. And when a husband is killed, is it a tragic accident or the murderous plot of his wife?

programme.title: The Perfect Wife
programme.desc: Penny Scaggs believed in being a dutiful Christian wife. She even taught local women how to build harmonious relationships. Then she was found brutally beaten and stabbed beside her beloved yellow piano. Was this a robbery gone horribly wrong-or was something in the Scaggs home out of tune?

programme.title: Blue-Eyed Butcher
programme.desc: When Susan Wright's husband, Jeffrey, was found buried in the backyard, stabbed 193 times, people dubbed her the blue-eyed butcher of the suburbs. But what was behind this murderous rage? The answers would result one of the most sensational trials in Texas history.
